item.title: Ticket #1687 (Latest Activity Header Muddled) created
item.dc:creator: shorty114
item.description:
The Latest Activity heading tag in the sidebar on the Dashboard is muddled, at least in my browser (Firefox 1.0.6, Ubuntu). All updates installed in Firefox.

This is from a trunk just checked out around 5 minutes ago.

I've attached a screenshot, to showcase this better. I'm not sure what's causing it, but I would guess it's in the CSS.

item.title: Ticket #1683 (Blogger Importer inserts comments directly) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Actually, I'd like to bust this up into multiple functions.

wp_insert_comment() would handle the DB insertion.

wp_allow_comment() would do the flood protection, check_comment(), wp_blacklist_check(), and other checks.

wp_new_comment_notification() would live in pluggable-functions and would call wp_notify_post_author() and wp_notify_moderator.

wp_new_comment() would wrap all of these up into one call.

Importers would call wp_insert_comment() and thus avoid the comment checks and mail notifications.

wp_new_comment() would continue to be used as is.

item.title: Ticket #1685 (the_content_rss() incorrectly applying filters to the_content) created
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description:
the_content_rss() function is not applying filters to the_content_rss, but rather to the_content. This is (of course) causing issues with default filters and plugins acting upon the_content_rss.

Line 21 in feed-functions.php should be:

$content = apply_filters('the_content_rss', $content);

item.title: Ticket #1684 (No trailing slash for WordPress/Blog Address (URI)) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #1684 (No trailing slash for WordPress/Blog Address (URI)) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
The offending code is in get_alloptions: 

if ('siteurl' == $option->option_name) $option->option_value = preg_replace('|/+$|', '', $option->option_value);
if ('home' == $option->option_name) $option->option_value = preg_replace('|/+$|', '', $option->option_value);

Why is this code necessary?

item.title: Ticket #1682 (Patch for wp_login_head Action in wp-login.php) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Keywords changed

Perhaps we should allow generic theming of the login page (i.e., a login.php file in a theme), rather than just a hook or two.

On the other hand, maybe not, as the login page is more admin than blog, and we don't currently allow styling of the admin pages (other than admin_head)

item.title: Ticket #1684 (No trailing slash for WordPress/Blog Address (URI)) created
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
Greetings,

I have setup WordPress at ​http://sub.domain.org/blog/

But at ​http://sub.domain.org/blog/ the Weblog title is linked to ​http://sub.domain.org/blog - without trailing slash

In the "General Options"... Am not able to change ​http://sub.domain.org/blog to ​http://sub.domain.org/blog/

Consider adding the trailing slash to the link

Right now, at TextDrive, am having a problem because

​http://sub.domain.org/blog redirects to ​http://domain.org/blog/

Even though I am asking TD to look into it, the trailing slash in the link would be better !

Or is there a reason for no trailing slash ?

Cheers, Kishore.

item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #1564 (More and NextPage buttons missing in WYSI editor (patch)) updated
item.dc:creator: JasonV
item.description: Ok, this seems to have fixed it: lines 163 and 173 in wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/wordpress/editor_plugin_src.js need to be changed from checking attribsname? to attribsclass?... or at least that did it for me. I'll try to put a patch together, but it might be quicker of somebody else did it, cause I haven't made a patch in a LONG time...
